MainScreen

Method Detail

getWeatherDataRunProc

private void getWeatherDataRunProc()
Performs the HTTP request on the forecast weather server. - Launch the JSON parser on server response - Launch the UI update: runOnUiThread(mUpdateUiRunnable); This method is expected to be run on a separate thread WARNING: - This is a blocking method - No UI access can be made from this method!!

See Also:
mGetWeatherDataRunnable, mUpdateUiRunnable, #parseCurrentWeather, #parseForecastWeather

updateUiRunProc

private void updateUiRunProc()
Display the current weather data on the GUI - test the asynch status before displaying weather information - stops the progress dialog

See Also:
getWeatherDataRunProc()

displayForecastByDay

private void displayForecastByDay(int aDayNumber)
Display the forecast weather details according to the day number forecast given in aDayNumber

Parameters:
aDayNumber - the day number for the weather forecast: D_DAY_PLUS_ONE..
See Also:
updateUiRunProc(), D_DAY_PLUS_ONE, D_DAY_PLUS_TWO

onSaveInstanceState

protected void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle outState)
DESC: onSaveInstanceState() is called by Android if the Activity is being stopped and may be killed before it is resumed. It is the counterpart to the onCreate() method. The savedInstanceState Bundle passed in to onCreate() is the same Bundle that we construct as outState in this onSaveInstanceState() method.

See Also:
onCreate()
